dt: {bc}relating to or being the mathematically simplest case
{bc}characterized by having all {d_link|variables|variable:2} equal to zero

dt.t: a {wi}trivial{/wi} solution to a linear equation

quotes.t: I had never heard anyone speak of their parents in this way; I never even knew you could make them seem {qword}trivial{/qword} …
But the last tribute was to be a struggle among states for possession of the {qword}trivial{/qword} remains of a man who in life had known as much revilement as honor.
His later memory, untutored and unsupported by anything so {qword}trivial{/qword} as evidence or documents, now flourished and ran wild.

et: Latin {it}trivialis{/it} found everywhere, commonplace, from {it}trivium{/it} crossroads, from {it}tri-{/it} + {it}via{/it} way {ma}{mat|way|}{/ma}
shortdef: relating to or being the mathematically simplest case; specifically : characterized by having all variables equal to zero

dt: {bc}a common or vernacular name of an organism or chemical

shortdef: a common or vernacular name of an organism or chemical
